intro: Alsine lydia, commonly known as Lydia's sandwort, is a low-growing annual plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to water conservation. Alsine lydia is an important species for stabilizing soil in desert environments and supporting local pollinator populations.
